item.title: Artemios Mintzas faces court for the first time on charges over Croydon Park shooting
item.description: The 60-year-old accused of shooting at over a dozen random members of the public in suburban Sydney has faced a magistrate after two lawyers got into an argument over who was representing him.

item.title: Body recovered during search for missing 15-year-old swimmer in Tamworth
item.description: A multi-agency search of the Peel River began on Monday night after police were told the teen had entered the water and failed to resurface.

item.title: Rescuers pull children from the rubble of Indonesian boarding school collapse
item.description: Rescue teams worked around the clock through narrow gaps in the rubble of Sidoarjo's Al Khoziny Islamic Boarding School while risking further collapse to reach anyone still alive.

item.title: Falling over a leading cause of hospitalisation, Injury Matters report highlights
item.description: Data shows one in three people aged over 65 will have a fall every year. But a Perth not-for-profit wants to send a message that falls are not an inevitable part of ageing.

item.title: ABC Sport cricket coverage announced for the Ashes 2025/26 as Australia hosts England
item.description: Darren Lehmann and Glenn McGrath will join a first-class line-up of cricket talent for ABC Sport's coverage of the Ashes.

item.title: Planning can help save you money this festive season
item.description: Australians estimate Christmas costs them about $800 a year, on average, but planning ahead can reduce the financial burden.

item.title: What the Health of the Nation report tells us about GP doctors by numbers
item.description: These five charts give us a glimpse into what the current state of general practice looks like in Australia.

item.title: Venezuela thwarts 'false flag' terror attack threat against US embassy in Caracas, Maduro says
item.description: Venezuela has alerted the Trump administration of a foiled "false flag operation" threatening to target the United States embassy in Caracas with explosives.

item.title: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch rules out further action against officer allegedly involved in road incident
item.description: WA's police commissioner rules out reopening a case in which a man alleges he was choked by an off-duty police officer, in front of his daughter, during a fight.

item.title: Copper prices to keep rising as demand grows and global production is hit by disruption
item.description: Copper is an essential industrial metal, but a series of major supply disruptions this year and a lack of new mines coming online have analysts warning of shortages in coming years.

item.title: South Australia declared free from brown rugose fruit virus after more than a year
item.description: More than a year since South Australia's $230 million tomato and capsicum sector was plunged into turmoil by the first discovery of the tomato brown rugose fruit virus in Australia, the state has been declared free of the exotic disease.

item.title: Hikers feared being buried by snow as blizzard hit Mount Everest
item.description: Hundreds of hikers are still trapped at an elevation of more than 4,900 metres as rescuers work to clear deep snow.

item.title: Jarvis Cocker on his wild wedding, Glastonbury, and Pulp's first album in 24 years
item.description: Love was "always problematic" for Jarvis Cocker, who fronts Britpop icons Pulp. But after decades of cynical songs on the subject, he's beginning to change his tune on romance.

item.title: Wilcannia Weir project relies on increased federal funding, NSW minister says
item.description: After decades of lobbying and design controversy, the New South Wales government says it needs another $30–40 million to proceed with the Wilcannia Weir upgrade.

item.title: Australian wins with a jaffle at World Porridge Making Championship
item.description: An oatmeal-filled jaffle made by a Melbourne food stylist and flavoured with Bundaberg Rum and bananas wins over judges in Scotland.

item.title: SA Police Commissioner Grant Stevens cleared over 1990s firearm incident
item.description: South Australia's corruption watchdog has cleared Police Commissioner Grant Stevens of a discipline breach for accidentally discharging his firearm during a house raid in the early 1990s.

item.title: Trump is deploying more troops on home soil — here's where things stand
item.description: US President Donald Trump is ramping up efforts to deploy the National Guard in more cities across the country to combat what he claims is a "war from within". Here's a quick rundown on where Mr Trump has stationed troops — and which cities might be next.

item.title: Gerard Community Council Aboriginal Corporation pleads guilty to failing to lodge reports
item.description: The corporation has been fined $2,000 for failing to lodge reports to the Office of the Registrar of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Corporations.

item.title: Suspects in Bega stabbing death still at large, as police rule out chainsaw injuries
item.description: Authorities say they are still piecing together who was involved in a "violent altercation" that left a man fatally stabbed and another in hospital.

item.title: Australia confident in batting at Women's Cricket World Cup, as Pakistan match approaches
item.description: Beth Mooney has predicted Australia's new approach to ODI cricket will pay off in the Women's Cricket World Cup, with a greater desire to take the game on.

item.title: Gold Coast mayor says Qld government hoarding cyclone recovery funds
item.description: Gold Coast mayor Tom Tate is calling for the state government to hand over funding allocated to help cover the city's growing disaster recovery bill following Tropical Cyclone Alfred.

item.title: State of WA appeals $2.8 million compensation payment to Dion Barber for abuse in state care
item.description: The state of WA is appealing a record $2.8 million compensation payment awarded to Dion Barber, who suffered repeated sexual abuse while in state care during the 1980s and 1990s.

item.title: Australia Kangaroos lose Xavier Coates and Zac Lomax ahead of rugby league Ashes in England
item.description: Australia suffers a double blow with Zac Lomax and Xavier Coates ruled out of the overseas tour through injury.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Man in hospital after shooting near Mackay
item.description: A man is in hospital in a stable condition after being shot in the hip during an altercation at a cane farm south of Mackay.

item.title: Police tactical operation in Revesby leaves cars with holes, windows smashed
item.description: A major police operation has taken place in Sydney's south-west after tactical operations officers conducted a "high risk" arrest on a suburban street.

item.title: Surfer bitten twice by shark chasing seal off Kangaroo Island
item.description: A surfer who was twice bitten by a shark that was reportedly chasing a seal in waters off Kangaroo Island, is recovering well with a coffee, according to his boss.

item.title: Sheffield Shield round one: Victoria and NSW register wins, Tasmania bats for a draw against Queensland
item.description: Victoria has upset reigning Sheffield Shield holders South Australia at the Adelaide Oval.

item.title: Diamonds looking to change things up in second netball Test against South Africa
item.description: Australian coach Stacey Marinkovich says she needs to try different combinations ahead of the Test series against New Zealand.

item.title: Robin Williams's daughter begs fans to stop making AI content of her father
item.description: The daughter of the late actor Robin Williams has condemned AI-generated content featuring her father's likeness.

item.title: Scientists win Nobel Prize in Physics for discoveries in quantum mechanics
item.description: Three scientists have won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics for "the discovery of macroscopic quantum mechanical tunnelling and energy quantisation in an electric circuit".

item.title: Emmanuel Macron urged by his first PM to resign in escalating French crisis
item.description: Emmanuel Macron's first prime minister urges the cornered French head of state to resign in a shock call that compounded an escalating political crisis.

item.title: Recently-elected German mayor Iris Stalzer in critical condition after being stabbed outside home
item.description: Iris Stalzer, a Social Democrat who was elected mayor of Herdecke in the Ruhr region a week ago, is reportedly suffered life-threatening injuries.

item.title: Research shows females carry a much higher genetic risk for major depression than males
item.description: In a study involving about 200,000 people diagnosed with depression, scientists have identified almost twice as many genetic red flags in the DNA of females compared with males.

item.title: AFP Commissioner Krissy Barrett speaks with the ABC.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: New AFP boss warns hate crime laws may need to be strengthened further
item.description: In a wide-ranging interview as she begins as AFP commissioner, Krissy Barrett announces a new sub-terror strike force, and flags that newly written hate crime laws may need to be strengthened further.

item.title: Up to 3,000 flood victims' details have been given to ChatGPT. What does that mean for privacy?
item.description: Data experts say it is hard to know what the implications are for 3,000 flood victims who have had personal information uploaded to the AI platform by a government contractor.

item.title: BlueScope chief demands urgent action on 'broken' gas market to save industry
item.description: A future made in Australia? Not if gas prices keep rising, major manufacturers warn as they call for urgent action to secure affordable supply.

item.title: Anika Wells points to surprise stress test of triple-0 network ahead of bushfire season
item.description: The adequacy of Australia's emergency call network will be stress tested with a surprise drill ahead of bushfire season, as the opposition ramps up its assault over the communication minister's handling of last month's fatal triple-0 outage.

item.title: 'Everyday living cost' or assistive technology? NDIS participants frustrated with flexibility of rules
item.description: A year after a controversial NDIS change, advocates are growing increasingly concerned that "counterintuitive" and "nonsensical" funding decisions are reducing participant independence.

item.title: Warragul social group helping parents of children with disability find connection
item.description: Parents of children with disability can miss out on social support, but a Victorian physiotherapist hopes to change that.

item.title: Audit finds state government-run aged care facility inappropriately used restraints
item.description: A South Australian government aged care home, which looks after 23 people with dementia or complex disabilities, inappropriately used lap belts and other mechanical restraints to stop falls and control residents' behaviour, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Can Donald Trump win the Nobel Peace Prize? Experts say it's unlikely
item.description: US President Donald Trump has made no secret that he wants to win this year's Nobel Peace Prize. Here's why experts say it's unlikely he'll win the prestigious award.

item.title: Tourism operators seek more funding to mitigate algal bloom impact in SA over summer
item.description: Tourism, seafood industry and community representatives are calling for greater funding, education and travel incentives ahead of the release of the South Australian government's upcoming Summer Plan.

item.title: Sheffield Shield round one quick hits: Marnus Labuschagne enjoys timely century while Ashes Test hopefuls struggle
item.description: The Sheffield Shield is underway, with all eyes on the contenders for Australia's problematic opener spot. Here are five quick hits from the opening round of the season.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: R360 players to be banned from international rugby union
item.description: Rugby union players who sign up for the R360 breakaway franchise league will be ineligible for international selection, national governing bodies have confirmed.

item.title: Tasmanian government stadium report responds to planning commission's criticisms
item.description: The state government response to last month's scathing report from the planning commission says that while "change can be challenging", the "dream of a Tasmanian team representing our state in the AFL and AFLW is now within reach — we cannot turn back".

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Born as the first bombs fell, two-year-old Mohammad has known nothing but war
item.description: Children in Gaza are experiencing grief, loss, displacement, and starvation. For some, this is all they know or remember.

item.title: Trump says US will 'do everything possible' to prevent war if Hamas agrees to peace deal
item.description: Donald Trump insists the United States will "do everything possible" to prevent Israel restarting the war in Gaza, in the event Hamas agrees to a peace deal.

item.title: Gold price hits record high, topping $US4,000 an ounce for first time, amid US shutdown and lower interest rates
item.description: The price of gold has hit another record and is set to become Australia's second most valuable resource export after iron ore.

item.title: NSW Police intercept alleged 'kill team' near daycare centre in Revesby
item.description: Police say tactical officers foiled an alleged planned hit near a daycare centre in Revesby in Sydney's south-west on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: US Senate committee questions Trump's Pentagon nominee John Noh over AUKUS review
item.description: The AUKUS submarine pact may need "commonsense" action from both Australia and the US to make it more "sustainable", according to Donald Trump's nominee to oversee US defence strategy in the Indo-Pacific.

item.title: Regulator investigating WA fire that burnt 11,000ha and left residents homeless
item.description: Residents who lost their homes in a blaze that ripped through WA's southern wheatbelt in January may have to wait more than two years to seek compensation.

item.title: Saltwater crocodile found with mouth zip-tied shut in Adelaide River, sparking calls for stronger penalties
item.description: The discovery of a saltwater crocodile with its mouth bound shut by zip ties in a Darwin river has sparked outrage, with animal rights advocates calling for stronger wildlife protections.

item.title: As WA government looks set to bring Serie A game involving AC Milan to Perth, some football fans are not happy
item.description: Italian heavyweights AC Milan look set to play a match, for actual Serie A points, in Perth. What will the state government pay to lure them here, and why are some football supporters unhappy?

item.title: Surge in shark-tracking app downloads following fatal Sydney attack
item.description: There has been a surge in downloads of the SharkSmart app following the fatal attack of a Northern Beaches surfer — in a sign the incident has left some nervous to get back into the water.

item.title: Players concerned over Shanghai heat as Novak Djokovic collapses on court
item.description: Holger Rune says "there is always a limit" as soaring temperatures and humidity in Shanghai and Wuhan tennis events cause player distress.

item.title: AFL trade period, day three recap: Brisbane Lions land Oscar Allen, as Sam Flanders, Judd McVee and Brandon Starcevich find new homes
item.description: Oscar Allen's move to Brisbane is official as West Coast finds out what compensation it will receive for losing its captain. Here's how day three of the AFL trade period panned out.

item.title: Police investigating after body found on road in Newborough, Gippsland
item.description: The discovery was made early this morning. Traffic diversions are in place and specialist detectives are set to investigate.

item.title: Australian merino wool future positive after surging price restores grower confidence
item.description: Amid a run of price rises at Australian wool auctions, the next generation of growers say global demand and fresh confidence could mark a turning point for the fibre.

item.title: Taylor Swift wears Adelaide label Paolo Sebastian in The Fate of Ophelia music video
item.description: Founder and designer Paul Vasileff says he's grateful to have his Adelaide-made couture dress on the world stage with pop superstar Taylor Swift wearing it in the new The Fate of Ophelia music video.

item.title: Neighbour of Kotoni Staggs pays tribute to Broncos star after supporting family through husband's death
item.description: The neighbour of Kotoni Staggs pays tribute to the Broncos star for helping her through a devastating family death.

item.title: Australians are reading less than ever before. Here's how to read more books
item.description: Research shows Australians are reading fewer books than ever before. One writer shares her advice on how to make reading a daily habit.

item.title: Pam Bondi accused of using justice system to target Donald Trump's opponents
item.description: US Attorney-General Pam Bondi has faced heated questioning from senators over claims she's transforming the justice department into a "shield for the president and his political allies".

item.title: Arsenal lose 2-1 to Lyon at Women's Champions League as trio of Matildas feature
item.description: Arsenal goes down 2-1 to Lyon in the Women's Champion League as three Matildas stars make an appearance at Meadow Park.

item.title: WA iron ore mining shows no signs of slowing despite price drop concerns
item.description: Australia's two biggest iron ore miners continue to expand their operations in WA's Pilbara, despite warnings of waning demand.

item.title: More families raising children with cystic fibrosis staying in the bush
item.description: Two mums in rural Queensland have spoken about why they choose to live more than 1,000 kilometres from the Queensland Children's Hospital.

item.title: Single farmers in Western Australia ditch dating apps for something face to face
item.description: When the dating app radius won't reach the edge of your property, and you're harvesting grain from sun-up til sundown, how do you find a partner?

item.title: Hundreds of court cases potentially compromised amid Victoria Police investigation
item.description: Police have arrested a digital forensics officer and are investigating whether his work compromised hundreds of cases over nearly a decade including sexual offence and child abuse cases.

item.title: WA's Bibbulmun Track running record broken twice in one week
item.description: Two men have smashed the record for completing one of the world's longest walking tracks in the fastest time, within days of each other.

item.title: Glencore refinery sites stay open with taxpayer funds
item.description: The last Australian copper smelter processing third-party product will stay open after its owner accepted a support package.

item.title: Last night's harvest moon made for stunning photos. When is the next supermoon?
item.description: Stargazers from around the world have captured the luminous glow of October's supermoon.

item.title: Sam Kerr to play for Matildas for the first time in two years
item.description: Sam Kerr's two year absence from the Matildas is almost over, she's set to feature in friendlies later this month, while Mary Fowler is recovering well from her own ACL injury.

item.title: Australian Gaza flotilla member criticises federal government after being detained by Israel
item.description: An Australian activist accuses the federal government of not providing enough support after she and other members of a flotilla were detained by Israel.

item.description: Hundreds of trekkers, villagers and support staff have safely reached the Tibetan town of Qudang, according to Chinese state media.

item.title: Geelong Cats fined by AFL over third-party arrangements
item.description: The AFL fines Geelong $77,500 for failing to disclose third-party agreements with players over a six-year period.

item.title: High Court backs use of encrypted app to monitor crime figures after challenge by bikies
item.description: The High Court has ruled on the use of information gathered through the AN0M app, which was developed by the Australian Federal Police for surveillance.

item.title: Mark Latham's outburst outside court, as ex-partner pleads not guilty to intimate image charges
item.description: Independent MP Mark Latham has spoken out against former partner Nathalie Matthews during an ongoing legal battle, on the same day she pleaded not guilty to intimate image charges in a separate matter.

item.title: Male humpback whales race in pursuit of female during east coast migration
item.description: A drone photographer captures vision of a tightly packed pod of 11 humpback whales heading south in a race to mate off the NSW mid-north coast.

item.title: Dolly Parton's sister speaks out over singer's health concerns
item.description: Dolly Parton's sister has asked fans to pray for the country music singer's health just one week after the star delayed several concerts in Las Vegas.

item.title: Man spared jail time by ACT court after he raped and filmed woman without consent
item.description: A 38-year-old man has been spared jail time, partly on account of his autism diagnosis, after raping a woman he met online and filming their sexual encounters without consent.

item.title: Optus email mishap left department in dark about triple-0 outage, even after Anika Wells' office told
item.description: The telco operator sent two emails about its outage, which understated its extent, to a departmental email address that had been changed a week earlier.

item.title: NSW Police hold 'significant concerns' about planned pro-Palestinian march to Sydney Opera House
item.description: A senior NSW Police officer has expressed cynicism that a crowd of tens of thousands could be managed in a staggered manner.

item.title: Ecuadorian protesters filmed throwing rocks in alleged presidential assassination attempt
item.description: Five people have been detained after hundreds of protesters surrounded the presidential motorcade of Daniel Noboa and began throwing rocks and stones.

item.title: Buddhist monk Naotunne Vijitha pleads not guilty to historical child sexual assault charges
item.description: The head monk of a Buddhist temple, Naotunne Vijitha, has denied sexually assaulting six girls at the temple in Melbourne's south-east.

item.title: Childcare director Amanda Vassel fined for employing convicted child sex offender husband
item.description: Amanda Louise Vassel was sacked from her job at the south-east Queensland childcare centre after the matter came to light.

item.title: Alexander O'Sachy sentenced to 11 years in prison for stabbing Angela Godwin to death at their Brisbane home
item.description: The Supreme Court in Brisbane heard Alexander O'Sachy tried to clean up evidence of his crime before calling emergency services.

item.title: City of Stirling terminates football club's lease after player's alleged explicit Stephen Hawking costume
item.description: A Perth football club faces deregistration and has been expelled from their club rooms after a player reportedly attended a post-season party dressed as Stephen Hawking, allegedly with explicit images involving himself as a child attached.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Former clinical director Hannah Lake leads Hobart Clinic rescue bid
item.description: The former clinical director of the Hobart Clinic, psychiatrist Dr Hannah Lake, is part of a last-minute push for the institution to be given a reprieve before it closes its doors at the end of next week.

item.title: Melbourne man sentenced over medical cannabis company Cann Group insider trading case
item.description: A Melbourne man found guilty of insider trading during a $20 million capital raise by a medicinal cannabis company has been ordered to pay more than $225,000.

item.title: AFLW Carlton star Darcy Vescio says 'punching down' on Mad Monday must end
item.description: Inaugural Carlton AFLW star Darcy Vescio has urged players to be more conscious of their role-model status when dressing up for end-of-season celebrations.

item.title: Qantas says 'legal protections in place' as cyber hacking group threatens to release personal data
item.description: Qantas says it is continuing to support customers as a hacking group threatens to release personal data from around 40 companies to the dark web.

item.title: Trade restrictions for Philippines banana imports to be reviewed by federal government
item.description: The federal government will review its quarantine rules after a formal request by the Philippines to import its bananas, but the industry is pushing back.

item.title: Scramble to protect Kangaroo Island bee colony, one of the world's unique colonies, from varroa mite
item.description: A deadly parasite that has laid waste to bee colonies throughout Australia has so far not made it to Kangaroo Island, home to the world's oldest bee sanctuary.

item.title: Ex-Collingwood player Shannon Cox jailed for killing women in Brand Hwy car crash
item.description: Former Collingwood player Shannon Cox, who had meth in his system when his car smashed into a hatchback, killing two elderly women, is jailed for manslaughter.

item.title: Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium debate weighs 'expert' advice
item.description: Tasmania's minister responsible for the proposed $1.13 billion Macquarie Point stadium, Eric Abetz, says there are many "expert" views, but ultimately the government will decide.

item.title: Strava is suing Garmin for patent infringement. Here's what we know
item.description: Fitness app Strava and sports watchmaker Garmin usually go hand-in-hand, but the two fitness tech leaders are now in competition in a US lawsuit.

item.title: Stephen Miller has said Donald Trump has plenary authority but what does that actually mean?
item.description: A Trump administration official faces criticism after allegedly claiming US President Donald Trump has "plenary authority" while on a live interview with CNN.

item.title: Do dishwashers release microplastics when you wash plastic containers and kitchenware?
item.description: If you're worried about microplastics, is it safe to wash plastic containers and other utensils in the dishwasher, given the use of heat and detergents? We asked two experts.

item.title: Jon Stevens releases new album Shimmer, announces tour on 64th birthday
item.description: From teen idol to rock great, Jon Stevens has fronted legendary bands Noiseworks and INXS. He has chosen his 64th birthday to release a new album and announce a tour.

item.title: Three charged with murder and torture of Brisbane man Andrew Burow
item.description: Police will allege Andrew Burow endured a three to four-day ordeal which began after meeting with the accused in August.

item.title: Former RAAF pilot Robert John Crawford appears in court, charged with murder of wife Frances Crawford
item.description: Robert John Crawford has been charged with murder over the death of his wife at their home in July 2024.

item.title: Rex flight evacuated after engine catches fire at Adelaide Airport
item.description: Passengers have praised the actions of the pilot and cabin crew after a Rex aircraft was evacuated at Adelaide Airport this morning following a fire emergency.

item.title: City of Melbourne set to vote on security camera overhaul, surveillance powers for staff
item.description: The City of Melbourne is set to vote on a new plan that would see more privately owned CCTV cameras feeding into the city's security network and staff able to access the footage to investigate local law breaches.

item.title: Australia's parliament is likely to grow for the first time in 40 years
item.description: Australia's parliament is likely to get larger as the government canvasses possibilities for expanding the number of MPs and introducing fixed or four-year terms.

item.title: Algal bloom chief asked about 'disaster' declaration as inquiry told of thousands of marine deaths
item.description: The SA government has never formally requested that the Commonwealth declare the algal bloom a "national disaster", a senior bureaucrat has told a parliamentary inquiry — despite a state minister "advocating" for such a response three months ago.

item.title: Audit reveals widespread public housing electrical issues in wake of three-year-old's tragic death
item.description: The death of a three-year-old boy in an Alice Springs house fire has led to an electrical audit of Northern Territory public housing, which uncovered widespread issues affecting hundreds of homes, an inquest has heard.

item.title: Grieving Canberra dog owner warns of deadly blue-green algae but testing shows no increased risk
item.description: Toxic algae is sometimes detected in Canberra's waterways, where a dog died after swimming.

item.title: Jordan Spencer jailed for 13 years for setting woman alight
item.description: A 34-year-old Shepparton woman has been jailed for 13 years after dousing another woman with petrol and setting her on fire during a dispute over an e-scooter.

item.title: Murder trial begins for man accused of killing and burning David Collisson near Mudgee
item.description: David Collisson's remains were found near Mudgee in October 2023. It is believed he was shot dead a month earlier.

item.title: With pressure from China to last, more metals facilities could put their hands up for a bailout
item.description: The bailout of another metals facility — this time in Queensland — is unlikely to be the last, with pressures on the sector driven by China to keep up for years.

item.title: British man jailed in New York over $US99 million fine wine fraud scheme
item.description: The scheme ran from June 2017 to February 2019, and collapsed when interest payments stopped.

item.title: Mates channel MacGyver in rescue of galah trapped in power pole in WA's north
item.description: A lifetime sailor says his experience problem-solving with limited resources helped figure out how to rescue a galah trapped in an 8-metre-tall power pole.

item.title: Fatal shooting of man in Sydney's north-west a 'brazen' targeted attack, police say
item.description: A man was found with gunshot wounds on a street in Riverstone, in Sydney's north-west. A short time later two burnt-out cars were discovered nearby.

item.title: Callum Cook pleads not guilty to Christmas Day murder of Russell Klein in Millmerran
item.description: A barrister for the accused tells a Queensland court Callum Cook acted in self-defence during an incident that left a 55-year-old father dead in his front yard.

item.title: Labor backbencher calls for action to stop countries onselling Australian gas
item.description: Ed Husic calls for stronger action to prevent foreign countries that buy Australian gas from onselling it to other countries.

item.title: Myanmar's military uses paraglider to bomb festival and anti-junta protest
item.description: People were gathering for the festival and an anti-junta demonstration when bombs killed at least 20 people and injured dozens more.

item.title: Beth Mooney, Alana King save Australia from Women's Cricket World Cup upset loss to Pakistan
item.description: Beth Mooney's century and a classy unbeaten 51 from Alana King saves Australia from a stunning upset loss to Pakistan at the Cricket World Cup.

item.title: Latest Financial news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Trio of scientists awarded Nobel Prize in Chemistry for 'development of metal-organic frameworks'
item.description: Scientists Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi receive the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry "for the development of metal-organic frameworks", the award-giving body announces.

item.title: Diamonds put foot down to beat South Africa in 67-40 victory
item.description: Australia flew out of the blocks to take a 2-0 lead in the series and extend their unbeaten record against South Africa to an extraordinary 48 wins.

item.title: News Corp executive warns AI firms are asking Australia to 'surrender our stories'
item.description: News Corp Australasia executive chairman Michael Miller issues a call to arms for all media companies to stand together and demand the government rule out any changes to copyright laws.

item.title: Former FBI director James Comey pleads not guilty in Congress case
item.description: The guilty plea follows an extraordinary chain of events that saw Mr Trump publicly implore Attorney General Pam Bondi to take action against Mr Comey and other perceived adversaries.

item.title: Manchester synagogue attacker Jihad Al-Shamie pledged allegiance to Islamic State during attack, police say
item.description: British counter terror police say Jihad Al-Shamie called police during his attack on a Manchester synagogue to declare his allegiance to the terror group.

item.title: Jonathan Rinderknecht arrested and charged with deliberately lighting Pacific Palisades blaze in Los Angeles
item.description: Police arrested and charged Jonathan Rinderknecht over the fire this week, which was the most destructive in Los Angeles's history.

item.title: Can we still trust Australia's sunscreens?
item.description: Summer is just around the corner, and many Australians are confused right now about which sunscreens they can trust.

item.title: Optus wears blame but government needs to explain how it handled early advice
item.description: The government is determined to avoid wearing any blame for Optus' failure but also needs to be transparent about how it handled early advice from the telco.

item.title: Older Australians struggling to find work before hitting the pension age
item.description: In the three years that 65-year-old Kerry Forrest has been applying for positions, she has faced repeated rejection. She thinks it is time employers consider older workers more favourably.

item.title: Antarctic icebreaker's costly refuelling saga yet to be resolved
item.description: Two years after the RSV Nuyina was banned from going under Hobart's Tasman Bridge to refuel, the Australian Antarctic Division has formally ditched the possibility of trying to overturn the decision.

item.title: In voice notes from Gaza, Majeda chronicles her family's displacement and despair
item.description: The war in Gaza may be ending soon, but those displaced by Israel's bombardment and invasion know their suffering is far from over.

item.title: Renewed focus on 'kill cars' as police swarm on hit crew in Sydney's south-west
item.description: It is a tried and true tactic in the underworld when trying to get away with murder, but police have sought out "kill cars" and they are reaping the rewards from it.

item.title: Australia's energy transition in flux amid struggle to build major transmission arteries
item.description: Touted as a model for the energy transition, a "quick and easy" high-voltage powerline project linking South Australia directly to New South Wales is running dramatically over time and over budget.

item.title: University wrongly accuses students of using artificial intelligence to cheat
item.description: An Australian university has accused thousands of its students of cheating with artificial intelligence. The problem? Many have done nothing wrong.

item.title: Annabel Kennedy eyes F1 Academy after becoming first female to stand on Indian F4 podium
item.description: With success at home and abroad, Annabel Kennedy is part of a growing number of Australian women and girls making their mark in motorsport.

item.title: Third narco sub found in Solomon Islands, as cocaine and meth trafficking comes to the Pacific
item.description: Cousins Reubenson and Martin Fugui found a 'Made in Colombia' narco sub in Solomon Islands over the weekend — the third such vessel found in the country's waters over the past year.

item.title: Inappropriate use of restraints on Adelaide aged care home residents echoes elements of the Oakden scandal
item.description: An audit has revealed an Adelaide aged care facility was inappropriately using restraints on patients, raising the question of whether the state government has learned from the Oakden aged care scandal in 2017.

item.title: Queensland government urged to take stronger action on conservation as number of threatened species rises
item.description: The Queensland Conservation Council (QCC) has called out the LNP government for "not taking the environment seriously" with the number of flora and fauna species under threat on the rise.

item.title: Domain rental report for September quarter shows rent for houses stable across combined capital cities
item.description: Domain's September quarterly report shows house rents across the country's combined capitals have remained stable for five consecutive quarters.

item.title: Powerlifting champion aged 82 and ready to represent Australia
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man who turned to weightlifting for health now headed to powerlifting world championships at 82
item.description: Ravi Sood turned to the gym to help build muscle before a knee replacement. It has changed his life and led him to the World Masters Powerlifting Championships.

item.title: Police thought alleged Croydon Park gunman was 'fine' in weeks leading up to shooting
item.description: A close family member of Artemios Mintzas tells the ABC she asked police to visit his unit three weeks ago, after growing increasingly concerned about his state of mind.

item.title: Murray Watt nears deal with Coalition to finally overhaul environment laws
item.description: Environment Minister Murray Watt will sit down with his Liberal counterpart Angie Bell today, with quiet optimism in both parties that a deal might soon be struck to finally rewrite Australia's "broken" and outdated environment laws.

item.title: Infant's death in illegal Robinvale childcare centre among sector's secret failures
item.description: The death of a 15-week-old baby in an unlicensed home day care in Victoria’s north-west is among more than two dozen disturbing childcare incidents recorded in government documents unearthed by the ABC.

item.title: Advocates say First Nations children's commissioner must have power to make change
item.description: Governments have been unable to reduce the rates of First Nations children in out-of-care and youth detention. Advocates say the new children's commissioner needs the power to hold them to account.

item.title: Federal politics live: Shadow treasurer ejected from QT as Chalmers pokes fun
item.description: Shadow Treasurer Ted O'Brien was ejected from Question Time for interjecting as Jim Chalmers joked his counterpart's question wasn't "based on reality". Follow live.

item.title: Family donates $1.7 million to transform dementia care at aged care facility
item.description: An aged care facility in western Victoria receives an "unprecedented" donation that will allow it to enhance the lives of residents living with dementia.

item.title: Markets live updates: ASX rises as Wall Street notches fresh records, Fed split on rates
item.description: The S&P and Nasdaq have closed at new highs and Australian stocks are following the upwards trajectory. Federal Reserve officials are split on the outlook for US interest rates, the latest meeting minutes show. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Hereditary fructose intolerance group to raise awareness about often-misdiagnosed condition
item.description: A Queensland woman is on a mission to raise awareness about hereditary fructose intolerance, after having to wait until age 45 to understand why so many foods make her sick.

item.title: Endometriosis sufferers battling to manage pain as system struggles to cope
item.description: Women suffering from the chronic pain associated with endometriosis have called for more government investment into understanding the condition, with an expert warning the mental effects can be just as debilitating as the physical symptoms.

item.title: Manhunt underway after man shot dead, cars set alight in Sydney's Riverstone
item.description: NSW Police say they are exploring several lines of inquiry following the fatal shooting of Suman Mokhtarian in Sydney's north-west on Wednesday.

item.title: Gisele Pelicot tells rapist appealing guilty verdict to 'take responsibility'
item.description: Gisele Pelicot returns to court to face the only man, out of 51, who appealed against his guilty verdict in a mass rape trial that gained worldwide attention.

item.title: AFL trade period, day four live updates: Clayton Oliver, Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca latest
item.description: Gold Coast is in the thick of the action so far on day four of the trade period as fallen star Jamarra Ugle-Hagan prepares to do a medical with the club. Follow live.

item.title: Alex de Minaur wins 50th tennis match for 2025, reaching Shanghai Masters clash with Daniil Medvedev
item.description: Alex de Minaur wins 50 matches in a season for the first time in his career as he reaches the quarterfinals at the Shanghai Masters.

item.title: AC Milan star Adrien Rabiot says plan to play Serie A match in Perth is 'truly absurd'
item.description: AC Milan midfielder Adrien Rabiot hits out at plans to play a game in Perth, earning a rebuke from the Serie A chief executive.

item.title: Measles warning in WA's Pilbara as confirmed cases rise
item.description: Health authorities say they are not able to trace WA's latest measles cases to a source, meaning they cannot tell how far the virus has spread.

item.title: Beast of War is the indie shark movie that bit off a lot
item.description: Mystery Road star Mark Coles Smith and his Beast of War director Kiah Roache-Turner on taking a chomp out of WWII soldiers.

item.title: Self-taught child drummer makes rock band debut with The Living End
item.description: It was a dream come true when 12-year-old Noah Pope was pulled from the crowd to perform with The Living End.

item.title: Trump says Israel Gaza war ceasefire deal is 'very close', Rubio more cautious
item.description: Donald Trump is handed a note from Marco Rubio during White House talks saying: "We're very close to a deal in the Middle East."

item.title: Dolly Parton responds to concerns about her health, says she is not dying
item.description: Dolly Parton has taken to social media to hose down speculation about her health after a comment from her sister sent fans into a tailspin.

item.title: Sam Kerr returns to Champions League in Chelsea's draw with Twente Enschede
item.description: Australian striker Sam Kerr makes another appearance for Chelsea off the bench, getting 23 minutes of playing time but unable to break a 1-1 deadlock with their Dutch opponent.

item.title: NSW court rules in police's favour over planned Sydney Opera House pro-Palestine march
item.description: The Palestine Action Group had expected 40,000 people to attend the rally on Sunday.

item.title: Friends believe Mark Sear's disappearance in Kimberley is suspicious
item.description: Friends of Mark Sear, who has been missing in WA's Kimberley for nearly three weeks, say the disappearance should be treated as suspicious.

item.title: Israel and Hamas agree to first phase of peace plan, Donald Trump says
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Israel and the militant group Hamas have accepted the first phase of a peace plan.

item.title: Gaza live updates: Israelis and Palestinians celebrate agreement on first phase of peace proposal
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Israel and the militant group Hamas have signed off on the first phase of a Gaza peace proposal that would see a pause in fighting and the release of at least some hostages and prisoners.

item.title: Martin Dole appointed Northern Territory police commissioner after former top cop's sacking
item.description: Seven months after the Northern Territory's former police commissioner Michael Murphy was stood down, Acting Police Commissioner Martin Dole has been announced as the next person to take on the position of top cop.

item.title: Argentina-Puerto Rico football friendly moved from Chicago amid immigration crack down
item.description: An Argentine Football Association executive confirms an upcoming football match against Puerto Rico is moving from Chicago due to the National Guard being called in to quell immigration protests.

item.title: Mount Gambier's Urgent Care Clinic to reopen but GP shortage continues
item.description: While a government-funded medical clinic is set to reopen, residents in SA's second biggest city are still struggling to access local care.

item.title: Trump given note from Marco Rubio Gaza deal is 'very close'
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: First phase of Gaza deal 'likely' to be implemented: Aaron David Miller
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: RFS firefighter seriously injured by falling tree at Coutts Crossing
item.description: A volunteer firefighter is hospitalised with head and neck injuries after being hit by a falling tree on a fireground on the NSW north coast.

item.title: Fertiliser plant uncertainty puts Mount Isa Copper Smelter future in doubt despite bailout
item.description: Mining giant Glencore's government bailout was touted as its outback smelter's saving grace, but uncertainty about a fertiliser plant it relies on could still see it cease production before 2028.

item.title: UNICEF worker responds to news of potential Gaza deal
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Albany's tiny art gallery joins growing global community
item.description: A new tiny art gallery on WA's south coast adds to a growing global movement of community verge-side offerings that range from puzzles to seed exchange.

item.title: Victorian judge wrong about Erin Patterson's solitary confinement prospects, prosecutors say
item.description: In sentencing the triple-murderer, Justice Christopher Beale found there was a substantial chance she would remain in solitary confinement for years, which prosecutors dispute.

item.title: Victorian government defends bail laws as opposition criticises new judicial guidance
item.description: The Victorian government defends the strength of its bail laws, after the opposition criticised a recently updated guide instructing bail decision-makers to release an alleged child offender "whenever possible".

item.title: The draft order to approve Hobart's stadium has been released. So what's in it?
item.description: Tasmania's parliamentarians have received a draft version of the order they'll vote on to determine the fate of the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

item.title: Palestinians celebrate in Khan Younis
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Madeleine McCann's mother tells court she is distressed by stalker who claims to be her daughter
item.description: The mother of Madeleine McCann says a woman accused of stalking her for over two years made her feel distressed and "invaded" by approaching her at her house and claiming to be her daughter. Madeleine went missing in 2007, aged three.

item.title: RSL NSW president Mick Bainbridge and three board members resign in wake of 7.30 investigation into conflicts of interest
item.description: The president of RSL NSW Mick Bainbridge has resigned from the board along with three other directors in a shock move just minutes before a scheduled vote on his removal.

item.title: Hostage families celebrate in Tel Aviv following news of Gaza deal
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Victorian Liberal MP Wendy Lovell makes mass citizenship email mistake
item.description: A mass email from a Liberal MP wrongly congratulates many people across northern Victoria on becoming new Australian citizens.

item.title: Hit-and-run driver Jake Danby's case sparks outrage in NT communities as victim's family calls for jail time
item.description: A fatal hit-and-run case in Darwin has exposed deep disparities in the NT’s justice system, say Aboriginal leaders, as the victim’s family speaks out.

item.title: Cricketing legend Meg Lanning on starting the new season of the WBBL
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Former ACT attorney-general Gordon Ramsay charged with grooming teen
item.description: Former ACT attorney-general Gordon Ramsay has faced the ACT Magistrates Court, charged with grooming a teenage boy.

item.title: Cessnock Rifle Club captain charged with manslaughter after pig hunting incident
item.description: A 63-year-old rifle club captain has been granted bail after being charged with manslaughter over a shooting incident in the NSW Hunter Valley.

item.title: Israel and Hamas have reached an agreement. What does this mean for the Gaza peace plan?
item.description: All of the living Israeli hostages in Gaza could be released as soon as next week under the first phase of a peace plan led by the United States — but the full details are yet to be released. Here is what we know so far.

item.title: Donald Trump calls hostage families in Washington DC
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: UN to slash quarter of peacekeepers in nine operations globally due to lack of funds
item.description: That would amount to between 13,000 and 14,000 troops and police removed from their nine operations around the world.

item.title: Disastrous McCrae landslide was caused by burst water main, Board of Inquiry finds
item.description: A major inquiry into the disastrous January landslide on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula concludes the incident was caused by a burst main that gushed water for months beforehand.

item.title: Man charged with careless driving over fatal crash involving CBH grain train near Albany
item.description: The man behind the wheel of a car that collided with a freight train near Albany, killing his female passenger, has been charged with careless driving.

item.title: Former RAAF pilot Robert John Crawford to stand trial over alleged murder of wife, Frances Crawford
item.description: Robert John Crawford has pleaded not guilty to the murder of his wife Frances Crawford, who was found dead at the couple's home last year.

item.title: Pat Cummins's injury recovery continues ahead of Ashes, Mitchell Starc confident he can perform
item.description: Australia captain Pat Cummins is in serious doubt for the Ashes and has almost been ruled out of appearing in the first Test as he continues his recovery from a back injury.

item.title: Denmark to ban social media for under 15s, following Australia's world-leading laws
item.description: Denmark is planning to ban children under 15 from using social media, following Australia's world-first laws to curb social media use among teenagers.

item.title: Israel hostage families celebrate at prospect of ceasefire deal
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Gaza emergency doctor evacuated, reunites with husband Dr Mo in Perth
item.description: Mohammed Mustafa and Nour Dalloul got married while bombs exploded around them. Now their war-torn love, forged in the emergency rooms of a Gazan hospital, has found a home in Australia.
